Element.Name: Specification identification
Element.Description: Identifies the specification of content and rules that apply to the transaction.

Element.Name: Business process type identifier
Element.Description: Identifies the BII profile or business process context in which the transaction appears. Values to be used are either urn:fdc:peppol.eu:poacc:bis:catalogue_only:3 or urn:fdc:peppol.eu:poacc:bis:catalogue_wo_response:3

Element.Name: Catalogue identifier
Element.Description: A catalogue instance must contain an identifier which enables the document instance to be uniquely referenced for various purposes including referencing between transactions that are part of the same process.

Element.Name: Catalogue action code
Element.Description: Identifies how a received catalogue should be used against existing catalogue lines sent in previous catalogues, so that no discrepancies occur between the suppliers and customers information. Describes how to treat existing items, not part of the received catalogue and those that are included (unchanged, changed or deleted). Default action is to fully replace the source catalogue.

Element.Name: Catalogue name
Element.Description: A name of the catalogue for general reference. E.g. "Christmas catalogue"

Element.Name: Catalogue issue date
Element.Description: The date on which the catalogue instance was issued. Format = "YYYY-MM-DD"

Element.Name: Catalogue version
Element.Description: The version of the catalogue revision. The version ID is used to controll how a Catalogue transaction acts on existing lines that are not stated in the transactions. Should they be left alone or deleted. If Catalogue transaction is 'Replace' then action codes on the line have no relevance. All existing lines are deleted and the ones stated in the Catalogue transaction added. If Catalogue transaction is 'Update' then action codes on lines controll each line.

Element.Name: Catalogue validity period
Element.Description: The period during which the content of the catalogue is valid and can be used for trade.

Element.Name: Period start date
Element.Description: The date on which the period starts. The start dates counts as part of the period.

Element.Name: Period end date
Element.Description: The date on which the period ends. The end date counts as part of the period.

Element.Name: Contract reference
Element.Description: The identification of a contract.

Element.Name: Contract identifier
Element.Description: A reference that uniquely identifies a contract that relates to this transaction.

Element.Name: Source Catalogue reference
Element.Description: The identification of a source catalogue

Element.Name: Source catalogue identifier
Element.Description: Identifies the existing, already received catalogue that this message should be acted upon, so that no discrepancies occur between the suppliers and customers information.

Element.Name: Catalogue provider
Element.Description: The party that sends the catalogue. The seller or a catalogue repository.

Element.Name: Provider party electronic address
Element.Description: Identifies the provider party's electronic address

Attribute.Name: Scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: Scheme identifier for the electronic address

Element.Name: Catalogue Provider identifier
Element.Description: Use in the absence of or in addition to Party Name. Use an identifier known to the document recipient.

Attribute.Name: Scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: Scheme identifier of the Provider identification

Element.Name: Provider Postal Address
Element.Description: A group of business terms providing information about the address of the Catalogue Provider.

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.

Element.Name: City
Element.Description: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.

Element.Name: Post code
Element.Description: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.

Element.Name: Country Subdivision
Element.Description: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.

Element.Name: Address line 3
Element.Description: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

Element.Name: Catalogue Provider Country code
Element.Description: A code that identifies the country.The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.

Element.Name: Provider legal registration name
Element.Description: The name under which the provider is legally registered.

Element.Name: Provider legal registration identifier
Element.Description: A catalogue may contain the identifier assigned to the party by the national company registrar.

Attribute.Name: Provider legal registration identifier identification scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: The identification scheme identifier of the provider legal registration identifier.

Element.Name: Provider legal registration city
Element.Description: The name of the city where the provider is legally registered.

Element.Name: Catalogue Provider Country code
Element.Description: A code that identifies the country.The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.

Element.Name: Catalogue receiver
Element.Description: The party to which the catalogue is sent. Buyer or a catalogue repository on his behalf.

Element.Name: Reciever party electronic address
Element.Description: Identifies the receiver party's electronic address

Attribute.Name: Scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: Scheme identifier for the electronic address

Element.Name: Catalogue receiver identifier
Element.Description: Use in the absence of or in addition to Party Name. Use an identifier known to the document recipient.

Attribute.Name: Scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: Scheme identifier for Receiver identifier

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.

Element.Name: City
Element.Description: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.

Element.Name: Post code
Element.Description: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.

Element.Name: Country subdivision
Element.Description: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.

Element.Name: Address line 3
Element.Description: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: A code that identifies the country.The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.

Element.Name: Receiver legal registration name
Element.Description: The name under which the receiver is legally registered.

Element.Name: Receiver legal registration identifier
Element.Description: A catalogue may contain the identifier assigned to the party by the national company registrar.

Attribute.Name: Provider legal registration identifier identification scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: The identification scheme identifier of the provider legal registration identifier.

Element.Name: Receiver legal registration city
Element.Description: The name of the city where the receiver is legally registered.

Element.Name: Receiver legal registration country
Element.Description: A code that identifies the country.The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.

Element.Name: Catalogue supplier
Element.Description: The party that provides the items specified in the catalogue.

Element.Name: Supplier party electronic address
Element.Description: Identifies the supplier party's electronic address

Attribute.Name: Scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: Scheme identifier for the electronic address

Element.Name: Catalogue supplier identifier
Element.Description: Use in the absence of or in addition to Party Name. Use an identifier known to the document recipient.

Attribute.Name: Scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: Scheme identifier for Catalogue supplier identifier

Element.Name: Catalogue supplier trading name
Element.Description: Use in the absence of or in addition to Party Identifier.

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.

Element.Name: City
Element.Description: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.

Element.Name: Post code
Element.Description: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.

Element.Name: Country subdivision
Element.Description: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.

Element.Name: Address line 3
Element.Description: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: A code that identifies the country.The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.

Element.Name: Contact person name
Element.Description: The name of the contact person.

Element.Name: Contact telephone number
Element.Description: A phone number for the contact person. If the person has a direct number, this is that number.

Element.Name: Contact email address
Element.Description: The e-mail address for the contact person. If the person has a direct e-mail this is that email.

Element.Name: Catalogue customer
Element.Description: The party who may order from the catalogue.

Element.Name: Customer party electronic address
Element.Description: Identifies the customer party's electronic address

Attribute.Name: Scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: Scheme identifier for the electronic address

Element.Name: Catalogue customer identifier
Element.Description: Use in the absence of or in addition to Party Name. Use an identifier known to the document recipient.

Attribute.Name: Scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: Scheme identifier for Catalogue customer identifier

Element.Name: Catalogue customer trading name
Element.Description: Use in the absence of or in addition to Party Identifier.

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.

Element.Name: City
Element.Description: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.

Element.Name: Post code
Element.Description: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.

Element.Name: Country subdivision
Element.Description: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.

Element.Name: Address line 3
Element.Description: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: A code that identifies the country.The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.

Element.Name: Contact person name
Element.Description: The name of the contact person.

Element.Name: Contact telephone number
Element.Description: A phone number for the contact person. If the person has a direct number, this is that number.

Element.Name: Contact email address
Element.Description: The e-mail address for the contact person. If the person has a direct e-mail this is that email.

Element.Name: General payment conditions
Element.Description: Information about the general payment conditions

Element.Name: Catalogue line
Element.Description: Catalogue line content

Element.Name: Line identifier
Element.Description: Each line must have an identifier that is unique within the document to make it possible to positively reference the line. For example, from other documents.

Element.Name: Line action code
Element.Description: Used to instruct the catalogue receier on what action should be taken on the identified line when revising a catalogue. See rule on catalogue version ID. When using Update or Delete codes, the entire Catalogue Line is updated or deleted.

Element.Name: Orderable indicator
Element.Description: Default value is True i.e. Item on the Catalogue Line can be ordered. Can be used to indicate if an Item is temporarily out of stock (via a Catalogue Update).

Element.Name: Orderable unit
Element.Description: The unit in which the item described in this catalogue line can be ordered. The same item can be described in more than one catalogue line with different orderble units. E.g. catalogue line 1 describes item X that can be ordered in boxes at a given price. Line 2 may describe the same item X as orderable in pallets where the price is lower.

Element.Name: Item net quantity
Element.Description: The net quantity of the item that is contained in each consumable unit, excluding any packaging materials.

Attribute.Name: Item net quantity unit of measure
Attribute.Description: The unit of measure that applies to the item net quantity

Element.Name: Order quantity increment
Element.Description: The increment of Orderable units that can be ordered.

Element.Name: Minimum order quantity
Element.Description: The minimum number of orderable units that can be ordered according to details provided in the catalogue line, such as price.

Attribute.Name: Minimum order quantity unit of measure
Attribute.Description: The unit of measure that applies to the minimum order quantity

Element.Name: Maximum order quantity
Element.Description: The maximum number of orderable units that can be ordered according to details provided in the catalogue line, such as price.

Attribute.Name: Maximum order quantity unit of measure
Attribute.Description: The unit of measure that applies to the maximum order quantity

Element.Name: Line warranty information
Element.Description: Warranty information that applies to the catalogue line item.

Element.Name: Packaging level
Element.Description: The packing level of the catalogue line.

Element.Name: Catalogue line validity period
Element.Description: The period during which the information in the catalogue line is valid. An orderable catalogue item is no longer orderable after the validity period expires. Used for example for promotional items or prices.

Element.Name: Period start date
Element.Description: The date on which the period starts. The start dates counts as part of the period.

Element.Name: Period end date
Element.Description: The date on which the period ends. The end date counts as part of the period.

Element.Name: Standardized unit price
Element.Description: The item price based on a standarized unit. E.g. Price of each liter.

Attribute.Name: Currency identifier
Attribute.Description: Mandatory attribute

Element.Name: Standard unit quantity
Element.Description: The quantity of standard units that are in each consumable unit.

Attribute.Name: Standard unit of measure
Attribute.Description: The standard unit of measure used to enable comparison of item price to other items.See guideline on Items and packing units in a catalogue.

Element.Name: Item identifier
Element.Description: The sellers identifier for the related item.

Element.Name: Item quantity
Element.Description: The quantity that applies to the relationship.

Attribute.Name: Packed units
Attribute.Description: The prepacking the article is available in inside the orderable unit (next lower level packing), and which contains the number of unit described in PackSizeNumeric. Unit desciption to PackQuantity. The value shoud be a valid UOM code like XCS for case.

Element.Name: Item identifier
Element.Description: The sellers identifier for the related item.

Element.Name: Item quantity
Element.Description: The quantity that applies to the relationship.

Attribute.Name: Related item unit
Attribute.Description: The packaging unit for related items. The value shoud be a valid UOM code like XCS for case.

Element.Name: Item identifier
Element.Description: The sellers identifier for the related item.

Element.Name: Item quantity
Element.Description: The quantity that applies to the relationship.

Attribute.Name: Required item units
Attribute.Description: The packaging unit for required related items. The value shoud be a valid UOM code like XCS for case.

Element.Name: Item identifier
Element.Description: The sellers identifier for the related item.

Element.Name: Item quantity
Element.Description: The quantity that applies to the relationship.

Attribute.Name: Replaced item units
Attribute.Description: The packaging unit for replaced items. The value shoud be a valid UOM code like XCS for case.

Element.Name: Price lead time
Element.Description: The order lead time for the particular location.

Attribute.Name: Lead time units
Attribute.Description: The lead time units for price lead time. The value shoud be a valid UOM code like DAY for days.

Element.Name: Quantity threshold
Element.Description: Used to indicate the threshold quantity for the given price

Attribute.Name: Quantity threshold units
Attribute.Description: The quantity units for minimum quantity. The value shoud be a valid UOM code like XCS for case.

Element.Name: Quantity ceiling
Element.Description: Used to indicate maximum quantity for given price.

Attribute.Name: Quantity ceiling units
Attribute.Description: The quantity units for ceiling quantity. The value shoud be a valid UOM code like XCS for case.

Element.Name: Applicable terriroty address
Element.Description: Used to give location information related to the price

Element.Name: Address line 1
Element.Description: The main address line in a postal address usually the street name and number.

Element.Name: Address line 2
Element.Description: An additional address line in a postal address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line. Common use are secondary house number in a complex or in a building.

Element.Name: City
Element.Description: The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.The common name of the city where the postal address is. The name is written in full rather than as a code.

Element.Name: Post code
Element.Description: The identifier for an addressable group of properties according to the relevant national postal service, such as a ZIP code or Post Code.

Element.Name: Country subdivision
Element.Description: For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.For specifying a region, county, state, province etc. within a country by using text.

Element.Name: Address line 3
Element.Description: An additional address line in an address that can be used to give further details supplementing the main line.

Element.Name: Country code
Element.Description: A code that identifies the country.The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.

Element.Name: Item price
Element.Description: The price for the item at the specified locations.The price is given for each orderable unit.

Attribute.Description: Mandatory attribute

Element.Name: Item price base quantity
Element.Description: The number of item units to which the price applies

Attribute.Name: Item price base quantity unit of measure code
Attribute.Description: The unit of measure that applies to the Item price base quantity.

Element.Name: Price type
Element.Description: The type of the item price. The type may be given by using codes from UN/CEFACT code list 5387. When prices are temporary the validity period for the price should be defined by stating the price validity period.

Element.Name: OrderableUnit FactorRate
Element.Description: The factor used to convert the Base Quantity to an Orderable Unit. Must be specified if the Orderable Unit differs from the Base Quantity. If not present, assumed value is 1

Element.Name: Period start date
Element.Description: The date on which the period starts. The start dates counts as part of the period.

Element.Name: Period end date
Element.Description: The date on which the period ends. The end date counts as part of the period.

Element.Name: Item description
Element.Description: Free-form field that can be used to give a text description of the item. A detailed description of the item.

Element.Name: Packed quantity
Element.Description: The number of packed units that are in the orderable unit. E.g. if the orderable unit is a pallet that contains 30 boxes then the packed units are BOX and the packed quantity is 30.

Attribute.Name: Packed quantity unit of measure code
Attribute.Description: The unit of measure that applies to the packed quantity.

Element.Name: Consumable unit quantity
Element.Description: Specifies the number of consumable units that are in each orderable unit.

Element.Name: Item name
Element.Description: A short name for an item.

Element.Name: Item key words
Element.Description: Used to specify searchable keywords and/or synonyms for the Item. E.g. Item Name = Colgate or Total / Keyword =Toothpaste

Element.Name: Brand name
Element.Description: A Brand name for the item

Element.Name: Buyers item identifier
Element.Description: An identifier, assigned by the buyer, for the item. Associates the item with its identification according to the buyer's system.

Element.Name: The Sellers item identifier
Element.Description: An identifier, assigned by the seller, for the item. Associates the item with its identification according to the seller's system.

Element.Name: Manufacturers item identifer
Element.Description: The manufacturers identifier for the item.

Element.Name: Item standard identifier
Element.Description: An item identifier based on a registered scheme. Associates the item with its identification according to a standard system.

Attribute.Name: Item standard identifier identification scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: The identification scheme identifier of the Item standard identifier

Element.Name: Attachment ID
Element.Description: A positive identification of the relevant document, such as an unique identifier.

Element.Name: External Item Specifications Type
Element.Description: A functional description of the attachment/image expressed as code

Element.Name: Attached item description
Element.Description: A short description of the document type.

Element.Name: Attached object
Element.Description: The attached document embeded as binary object, coded as Base64. The binary object has two supplementary components: a Mime Code, which specifies the Mime type of the attachment and a Filename that is provided by (or on behalf of) the sender of the document

Attribute.Name: Attached object Mime code
Attribute.Description: The mime code of the attached document

Attribute.Name: Attached document Filename
Attribute.Description: The file name of the attached document

Element.Name: External item specifications
Element.Description: URI reference to external item information or specifications. E.g. web address

Element.Name: Item origin country
Element.Description: A code that identifies the country.The lists of valid countries are registered with the ISO 3166-1 Maintenance agency, "Codes for the representation of names of countries and their subdivisions". Codes must be according to the alpha-2 representation.

Element.Name: Item classification code
Element.Description: A classification code used to classify the type or nature of the Item. More than one classifications can be used including UNSPSC code and CPV code.

Attribute.Name: Item classification identifier identification scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: The identification scheme identifier of the Item classification identifier

Attribute.Name: Item classification identifier version identification scheme identifier
Attribute.Description: The identification scheme version identifier of the Item classification identifier

Attribute.Name: Clear text name equivalent of classification code
Attribute.Description: The textual equivalent of the code value

Element.Name: Contracted item indicator
Element.Description: The code CT indicates that the item is offered in accordance to the referenced contract.

Element.Name: Hazardous item UNDG code
Element.Description: The identifier assigned to transportable hazardous goods by the United Nations, expressed as a code.

Element.Name: Haszardous hazard class Identifier
Element.Description: Identifies a hazard class applicable to dangerous goods as defined by the relevant regulation authority, such as the IMDG Class Number of the SOLAS Convention of IMO and the ADR/RID Class Number for the road/rail environment.

Element.Name: Item TAX category code
Element.Description: The TAX code that indicates what TAX details apply to the item.

Element.Name: Item TAX precentage
Element.Description: The TAX percentage rate that applies to the item unless specific trade reasons apply such as exemptions.
Tax scheme. E.g. “VAT” or “GST”

Element.Name: Additional item property
Element.Description: A group of business terms providing information about properties of the goods and services invoiced.

Element.Name: Item property name
Element.Description: The name of the property.The name must be sufficiently descriptive to define the value. The definition may be supplemented with the property unit of measure when relevant.

Element.Name: Item property code
Element.Description: Code for the item property according to a property code system.

Attribute.Name: Name code list id.
Attribute.Description: An identifier for the code list used for the Name code, this is bilaterally agreed

Element.Name: Item property value
Element.Description: The value of the item property.

Element.Name: Item property unit of measure
Element.Description: The unit of measure in which the property value is stated, if relevant. May not be relevant when properties are descriptive.

Attribute.Name: Value quantity unit of measure
Attribute.Description: The unit of measure that applies to the value quantity.

Element.Name: Property classification
Element.Description: Standardized and predefined classification of items properties.

Element.Name: Manufacturer party name
Element.Description: The name of the manufacturer of the item

Element.Name: Item best before date
Element.Description: Used to express the best before date of the item or items in the line instance.

Element.Name: Item batch identifier
Element.Description: Identifies the production batch that the item(s) listed in the catalogue line were part of.

Element.Name: Item label information
Element.Description: Information about the items environmental, social, ethical and quality type of labelling.

Element.Name: Item label name
Element.Description: The name of the product label.

Element.Name: Certificate type code
Element.Description: The UBL structure used for item labeling requires this elements, use the value NA.

Element.Name: Item label type
Element.Description: The label type such environmental, quality, social etc.

Element.Name: Item label value
Element.Description: The label value that applies to the item.

Element.Name: Issuer name
Element.Description: The UBL structure used for item labeling requires this elements, use the value NA.

Element.Name: Item label reference
Element.Description: A reference to where the label specification can be found, e.g. a URI.

Element.Name: Attribute Id
Element.Description: Height - The vertical height of the orderable unit. Length - The horizontal measure of the longer site of the orderable unit. Width - The horizontal measure of the shorter side of the orderable unit. Weight - The weight of the orderable unit incuding its packaging. Package Net weight approximately. Package Net weight exact. Package volume.

Element.Name: Measure
Element.Description: The measure for the dimension attribute

Attribute.Name: Measure unit code
Attribute.Description: The unit code of the measurement

Element.Name: Dimension description
Element.Description: Used for differentiating between measures with same attributeID

Element.Name: Minimum storage temperature or minimum Storage Humidity
Element.Description: The lower margin of the recommended storage temerature range for the item.

Attribute.Name: Measure unit code
Attribute.Description: The unit code of the minimum storage humidity or temperature

Element.Name: Maximum storage temperature or maximum Storage Humidity
Element.Description: The upper margin of the recommended storage temerature range for the item.

Attribute.Name: Measure unit code
Attribute.Description: The unit code of the maximum storage humidity or temperature
